Welcome to the AI4H Lab

We are a dynamic research group at the Institute of Health Informatics (IHI), University College London (UCL). Our aim is to explore Artificial Intelligence (AI) applications in healthcare and implement them in real healthcare systems. Specifically, our work includes practical algorithm design, chronic disease care, hospital & patient management, precision medicine, health informatics, medical wearable technology, etc.

Previous Next

To this end, we develop ML & AI algorithms to estimate and predict events in various healthcare scenarios using data ranging from biomarker time series to hospital EHR. With the help of clinicians, patients and researchers, we also embed and deploy the proposed methods in hospitals & clinical trials, promoting AI from papers to healthcare systems to make real impact in improving human’s wellbeing.

We are located at University College London (UCL), the birthplace of Deepmind, and have close collaborations with NHS hospitals (UCLH, etc). Our Institute is home to a unique range of expertise and talent resulting in highly impactful, world-changing research using large scale data and advanced analytics.

We are looking for passionate new PhD students, Postdocs, and Master students to join the team (more info) !

We are grateful for funding from NHS-X, Rosetrees Trust, UKRI CDT, and UCL Hospital and Great Ormond Street Hospital.

News

Sep 2024

Hengrui Zhang received an award from the UCL Library Open Science Community as a runner-up in the UCL Open Science and Scholarship Award, under the category of Academic staff/PhD students - Open source software/analysis tools.

Sep 2024

Zhijun Guo, Joseph Farrington and Ken Li published “Large Language Models for Mental Health Applications - A Systematic Review” in JMIR Mental Health.

Aug 2024

Zhijun Guo and Ken Li published “Evaluating the Feasibility and Acceptability of a GPT-Based Chatbot for Depression Screening - A Mixed-Methods Study” in Artificial Intelligence in Healthcare.

July 2024

Joe Farrington attended 50th annual meeting of the EURO Working Group on Operational Research Applied to Health Services. Oral - Charting the Pareto frontier - Multi-objective optimization for platelet inventory management using neuroevolution.

June 2024

Joe Farrington’s AI software won the Healthcare Partnership of the Year category at the London Higher Awards 2024.

May 2024

Joe Farrington attended UKRI AI CDTs in Healthcare Conference. Poster - Many happy returns - a machine learning-based allocation policy to support platelet waste reduction in hospital blood banks.

May 2024

Chengzhe Piao attended UKRI AI CDTs in Healthcare Conference. Poster - Privacy Preserved Blood Glucose Level Prediction by Federated Learning.

Feb 2024

Chengzhe Piao attended ATTD’24. Poster - Personalized Blood Glucose Level Prediction Leveraging Population Features by Decentralized Federated Learning.

Nov 2023

Joseph Farrington and Ken Li published “Machine learning in transfusion medicine - A scoping review” in Transfusion.
